page.title: 13Woman's Life in Inchnadamph
page.content: Women here turn their hands to any- thing and work hard. They like animals and care about people. They help with the cows and feed the lambs,hens,dogs, cats and poultry. Women get up at 7.00 and go to bed at 11.00pm. They must make a packed lunch for the menfolk, giving them tomato, venison, cheese or egg sandwiches plus biscuits, buns and a flask of coffee. Dinner (6.00pm) is soup, meat and vegetables and pudding. Washing is done by electric machine and hung to dry. In sparetime, a woman might knit and usually goes to the {Women's Rural Institute}in Lochinver once a month. Also once a month there are{Presbyterian services}in Elphin (16km) where she may go with her family. Holidays are spent visiting relatives elsewhere. In summer she may take paying guests for bed and break- fast or work part-time in the hotel.
